com.peterson.markovbot

Class MarkovBot

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.peterson.markovbot.MarkovBot
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SynchronizedMarkovBot

    public class MarkovBot
extends java.lang.Object
    An example "bot" that assists in generating and maintaining Markov Chains. This bot allows the input of all sentences the generator uses so that it can be saved to a file for later use. This is a nice, interactive example that can be used to demonstrate Markov Chains
    Author:
    Peterson, Ryan Created 3/21/2015

    • Constructor Detail

      • MarkovBot

        public MarkovBot()
        Save-stateless constructor. This creates a MarkovBot that cannot save the data it encounters, and therefore it cannot be saved to a file. This also generates an initial state MarkovChain, ie. one that is empty.

      • MarkovBot

        public MarkovBot(java.io.File inFile)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Save-state constructor. This creates a MarkovBot that will both read in the entire file to generate a MarkovChain as well as write new data to a file if the saveNewPhrases() method is called.
        The precondition contract is such:
      • -The file exists; if not, see MarkovBot(File inFile, boolean createNew)
      • -The file to be read in has all phrases separated by a newline, as described by Files.readAllLines()

        • The runtime condition is such:
      • -All new phrases are to be saved with a new line separating them
      • -Calls to saveChains() write to the exact file passed in, appending the new data to it and clearing current save state data
Parameters:
inFile - the file to load as the bot's brain
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an IOException occurs with the file input

  • MarkovBot

    public MarkovBot(java.io.File inFile,
                 boolean createNew)
          throws java.io.IOException
    Save-state constructor with optional file creation. This creates a MarkovBot that will save new data to the passed file, but differs from MarkovBot(File inFile) in that, if createNew is true, it will create a new file named as the one passed in during construction. This does so even if the file already exists, effectively overwriting the contents. The general contracts specified in MarkovBot(File inFile) apply, except for the preconditions if createNew is false.
    Parameters:
    inFile - the file to save phrases to.
    createNew - true if the file does not exist and needs to be created, false if not
    Throws:
    java.io.IOException - if an IOException occurs with creating a file or loading the file.

  • Method Detail

    • addPhrase

      public void addPhrase(java.lang.String phrase)
      Adds a new phrase to the Markov generator. This both adds the phrase to the actual Markov generator as well as prepares that phrase to be saved.
      Parameters:
      phrase - the phrase to add to the Markov generator and to the file

    • addPhrases

      public void addPhrases(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> phrases)
      Adds new phrases to the Markov generator. This adds all the phrases in the Iterable to the Markov generator and to the running set of data to be saved to the file.
      Parameters:
      phrases - the phrases to add to the generator.

    • addPhrases

      public void addPhrases(java.lang.String... phrases)
      A varargs version of addPhrases(Iterable phrases) provided as convenience.
      Parameters:
      phrases - the varargs of phrases to add to the generator and data

    • generateSentence

      public java.lang.String generateSentence()
      Generate a random sentence from the generator.
      Returns:
      a random sentence from the Markov Chain generator
      See Also:
      for details.

    • generateSentences

      public java.lang.String[] generateSentences(int numberOfSentences)
      Generates multiple sentences from the generator. This is equivalent to calling generateSentence() more than once.
      Parameters:
      numberOfSentences - the number of Markov Chain sentences to generate
      Returns:
      an array of generated Markov chains.

    • saveNewPhrases

      public void saveNewPhrases()
                    throws java.io.IOException
      Save newly found phrases to the file passed at construction. The contract is that each new phrase is separated by a new line. After saving, the internal data storage of encountered data is cleared and starts off as empty.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an IOException occurs when trying to save the data
